sprint_goal: Establish a deployable application shell with end-to-end user registration and login flow, running on a fully automated infrastructure.
epic_coverage: Project Scaffolding & Foundational Infrastructure, User Account System & Data Persistence, Core Scientific Calculator & Frontend Shell
key_deliverables: Provisioned AWS infrastructure (VPC, RDS, Cognito, ECS). Backend & Frontend project skeletons. Functional user registration and login via Cognito.
demo_objectives: Show successful `terraform apply` of all infrastructure. Demonstrate CI pipeline running. Demonstrate user registration and login flow redirecting to Cognito and back to a placeholder app shell.
success_criteria: All infrastructure is provisioned. A new user can register, log out, and log back in.
risk_factors: Complexity of setting up the entire IaC and CI/CD pipeline from scratch. OAuth 2.0 PKCE flow is complex and security-critical.
mitigation_strategies: Prioritize critical path IaC tasks. Dedicate DevOps resource full-time. Use a battle-tested OAuth library.
burndown_target: Complete all IaC and Auth logic.

sprint_goal: Deliver a functional scientific calculator with basic arithmetic, history panel, and persistent history for logged-in users.
epic_coverage: Core Scientific Calculator & Frontend Shell, User Account System & Data Persistence
key_deliverables: Functional basic calculator UI. Session-based history for anonymous users. Persistent, cross-device history for logged-in users.
demo_objectives: Perform basic arithmetic and see results. Show history panel updating. Log in and show history being fetched from the server. Add a history item and verify it persists on another device/session.
success_criteria: Basic arithmetic works, including order of operations. History is successfully persisted and retrieved for authenticated users.
risk_factors: Potential for bugs in the core math expression parser. IDOR vulnerability risk in history API.
mitigation_strategies: Extensive unit testing for the parser. Mandatory security review and negative test cases for the history API.
integration_windows: FE/BE integration for history API on Day 3-6.
burndown_target: Complete all tasks for US-001, US-012, and US-054.

sprint_goal: Build the core of the user-extensible framework by implementing the custom mode creation wizard, including variable definition and the complex formula editor with real-time validation.
epic_coverage: User-Extensible Calculation Framework, Project Scaffolding & Foundational Infrastructure
key_deliverables: Multi-step wizard UI. UI for defining input/output variables. Formula editor with live syntax and variable validation.
demo_objectives: Walk through the wizard to define a simple custom mode (e.g., Area of a Circle). Show real-time error messages for invalid formulas. Successfully save the mode definition.
success_criteria: A user can successfully define and save a valid custom mode definition.
risk_factors: Algorithmic complexity of the real-time formula validator. State management for the multi-step wizard can be tricky.
mitigation_strategies: Use a third-party math parsing library. Design wizard state management carefully before implementation.
integration_windows: Integration with BE for saving modes on Day 7-9.
burndown_target: Complete all tasks for US-041, US-042 (implicit), and US-043.

sprint_goal: Deliver the full value of custom modes by implementing the secure execution environment and dynamic UI, enabling users to launch and use their created modes.
key_deliverables: Secure AWS Lambda for formula execution. Dynamic UI for launched custom modes. End-to-end functionality from launch to calculation result.
demo_objectives: Launch a previously created custom mode. Enter input values. Click 'Calculate' and show the correct results appearing in the output fields. Demonstrate error handling for invalid calculations (e.g., division by zero).
success_criteria: Custom modes can be launched and used to produce correct calculations. Security sandbox prevents execution of disallowed code.
risk_factors: Security of the `isolated-vm` sandbox (RISK-003). Lambda cold start latency impacting user experience (RISK-006).
mitigation_strategies: Strict security code review. Minimal IAM permissions. Load testing and provisioned concurrency for Lambda.
integration_windows: Full-stack integration of FE -> API Gateway -> Lambda on Day 4-8.

sprint_goal: Implement robust offline data synchronization, allowing users to make changes while disconnected and have them automatically sync upon reconnection.
key_deliverables: Service worker for app shell caching. IndexedDB-based queue for offline mutations. Sync manager for handling reconnection and conflict resolution.
demo_objectives: Go offline. Add items to history/variables. Go back online and show the data syncing successfully. Demonstrate 'last-write-wins' conflict resolution.
success_criteria: Data created offline is not lost and is successfully synced to the backend upon reconnection. Data conflicts are resolved predictably.
risk_factors: High complexity of managing distributed state and potential for data loss edge cases (RISK-001).
mitigation_strategies: Implement comprehensive E2E tests simulating various network failure and conflict scenarios.
